event.title: rafted down the Ohio River in 1788

data.event: The first European-American settlers rafted down the Ohio River in 1788 following the American Revolutionary War.
Hamilton County was organized in 1790, as the second county in the Northwest Territory.

event.title: attracted many German and Irish immigrants, especially after the Great Famine in Ireland and the revolutions in Germany in 1848

data.event: Rapid growth occurred during the 1830s and 1840s as the area attracted many German and Irish immigrants, especially after the Great Famine in Ireland and the revolutions in Germany in 1848.
